results.content:
Excellent.  Just what I was looking for.

This course is not a login creation course, or a database course, but a concise unpacking of using classes in PHP.  If you go into it with the right goal, this will be a great experience.

The material is well organized and presented, and moves at a good pace, thanks to the right-sized videos.  The instructor also recaps regularly and gives clear direction on what is most important to focus on, in each lesson.

I would like to have seen a bit more complexity in the project, but it is probably out of scope.
results.content_html:

results.content: Clarifying. If you are a beginner in PHP OOP and you have seen a teacher "create" an extensive application in another course, this course explains exactly what has been done and gives you options for further building in the application.
results.content_html: Clarifying. If you are a beginner in PHP OOP and you have seen a teacher "create" an extensive application in another course, this course explains exactly what has been done and gives you options for further building in the application.

results.content:
Yes, have finished 41% of the course, and so far it has been a good learning experience for me, a newbie.   True to his personal goal, Mr. Valentin explains each line of code very patiently and clearly.  The "what you should memorize" summary at the end of each video is helpful.  The video length, font-size, audio quality, and easily understandable English are all plus points.  Eagerly looking forward to learn from the rest of the course.  

Thank you, Mr. Stan Valentin, and best wishes.
results.content_html:

results.content:
The final project was disappointing, it did not make good use of OOP as explained earlier in the course. The login had no security and beyond basic.

I did learn from the OOP explanations but again, the final project was not helpful.

I hope I learned enough to complete my task.

response.content: Hi Mark. I just mentioned that the created class does not have all the necessary stuff like security and filtering of data because it would have been redundant to the purpose of the course. Even if contains some detailed explanations, in fact is a foundation of OOP not an exhaustive course on how to build login classes. The idea is to place in one class some of the concepts presented separately and to see it working. That helps a lot of learners to see something practical. Thanks for the review!
